com.gracenote.gnsdk
Class GnLocale

java.lang.Object
  com.gracenote.gnsdk.GnLocale

public class GnLocale
extends java.lang.Object

Loads Gracenote data for a specified locale.

The GNSDK provides locales as a convenient way to group locale-dependent metadata specific to a region (such as Europe) and language that should be returned from the Gracenote Service. A locale is defined by a group (such as Music), a language, a region and a descriptor (indicating level of metadata detail), which are identifiers to a specific set of lists in the Gracenote Service.

The GNSDK uses locales for various reasons and it is a best practice to have an appropriate locale loaded. Work with your Gracenote representative to determine what locale group and descriptor to load.

SDK Documentation

Topic: Implementing Applications (All Platforms) > Loading a Locale

For more information on locales, see the above topic, which covers the following:

  • General information about locales
  • Code samples, in multiple programming languages, showing how to load a locale
  • Locale dependent data
  • Default regions and descriptors
  • Locale groups
    • Multi-threaded access
    • Updating locales and lists
    • Update notification
  • Locale Behavior
  • Best practicles for using locales

         throws GnException
Loads the specified locale

Parameters:
group - Locale group
language - Locale data language
region - Locale region (where applicable)
descriptor - Descriptor, or granularity, of the locale data where applicable
user - User object
pEventHandler - Status events delegate

Note

This method blocks the current thread until the load is complete; set an IGnStatusEvents delegate to receive progress updates.

Long Running Potential: Network I/O, File system I/O

GnException

update

public boolean update(GnUser user,
                      IGnStatusEvents pEventHandler)
               throws GnException
Updates a locale with newer locale data, if available. To ensure the Gracenote Service can be contacted to test for a new list version, your application needs to configure the user's lookup mode to allow online access.

To cancel the update procedure, set the "canceller" in any method called in the status event delegate.

Parameters:
user - User requesting the locale update
pEventHandler - Status events delegate
Returns:
True indicates updates were applied, false indicates no updates are available

Note

This methods blocks the current thread until the update procedure is complete; set a status events delegate to receive progress messages.

Long Running Potential: Network I/O, File system I/O

Throws:
GnException

update

public boolean update(GnUser user)
               throws GnException
Updates a locale with new versions of the locale data, if available. The application must ensure Gracenote Service can be contacted to test for a new list version by appropriately configuring the user's lookup mode to allow online access.

Parameters:
user - User requesting the locale update
Returns:
True indicates updates were applied, false indicates no updates are available

Note

This methods blocks the current thread until the update procedure is complete; set a status events delegate to receive progress messages.

Long Running Potential: Network I/O, File system I/O

Throws:
GnException

updateCheck

public boolean updateCheck(GnUser user,
                           IGnStatusEvents pEventHandler)
                    throws GnException
Tests a locale to determine if newer locale data is available. If it is, your application should call Update()to download it. To ensure the Gracenote Service can be contacted to test for a new list version, your application needs to configure the user's lookup mode to allow online access.

To cancel the update check procedure, set the "canceller" in any method called in the status event delegate.

Parameters:
user - User requesting the locale update check
pEventHandler - Status event delegate
Returns:
True indicates updates are available, false otherwise.

Remarks:

You can invoke this method periodically to check the Gracenote Service for locale data updates.

Note:

You should immediately check for updates after constructing a locale object from a saved serialized locale string as it may be out of date.

This methods blocks the current thread until the update procedure is complete; set a status events delegate to receive progress notification updates.

Long Running Potential: Network I/O

Throws:
GnException

updateCheck

public boolean updateCheck(GnUser user)
                    throws GnException
Tests a locale to determine if a newer revision of any locale data is available. If available the new data is not downloaded. To download the application must invoke update. The application must ensure Gracenote Service can be contacted to test for a new list version by appropriately configuring the user's lookup mode to allow online access.

Parameters:
user - User requesting the locale update check
Returns:
True indicates updates are available, false otherwise.

Remarks:

This method can be invoked periodically to check Gracenote Service for updates to locale data.

Note:

You should immediately check for updates after constructing a locale object from a saved serialized locale string as it may be out of date.

This methods blocks the current thread until the update procedure is complete; set a status events delegate to receive progress messages.

Long Running Potential: Network I/O

Throws:
GnException

serialize

public GnString serialize()
                   throws GnException
Serializes locale data into an encrypted text string that you can store locally for later use.

Note:

If your application is using a GNSDK local storage solution, locale data is automatically stored and retrieved from a local store according to the user lookup option configuration. If you are implementing your own local storage functionality, you can use this method to render a locale into a format that can be stored persistently and restored at a later time using the appropriate constructor.

Returns:
Serialize locale data
Throws:
GnException

public boolean isNull()
